intro: Epidendrum schlechterianum var. longirepens, commonly known as the Long-stemmed Schlechter's Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear numerous fragrant, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments.
